Often email account come with different alias like:
name.surname@xyz.com
login@xyz.com
login@seconddomain.com

Now if people are writing an email to one of the other aliases which are not the present default for this account in tb a reply to all recipients results in a copy being sent to oneself, since tb thinks that the alias is a different person. 

In would be nice if the address book would be able to alias different email addresses so tb can avoid unnecessary messages. Also this aliasing could be exploited in the search. 

Reproducible: Always
comments.author: bugzilla@onlinehome.de

comments.raw_text:
Hi Ludovic,

you need to get an email adress with to alias i.e
emailA@something.com
emailB@something.com
which are in reality only one inbox. Now send an email from an arbitrary third email adress
email@somethingelse.com
to emailA@something.com.
Asume your standard profile in thunderbird to which you receive this email is emailB@something.com
Now press "reply all" and reply. You will get all further reply to erverybody twice since tb didn't know that 
emailA@something.com
emailB@something.com
are in fact one and the same adress and thus also replied to 
emailA@something.com
although this was not needed.

Is it clear now?
